reviews.review: Very fun game, brilliant with friends!

I have watched this game played on Twitch a million times but never felt like I would be very good or enjoy it. Well I was wrong. It is so much fun to play and such an adrenaline rush. Its terrifying with all the sounds and killers sneaking up on you and oh so satisfying to hack up a toxic survivor. Definitely recommend for people who like horror games with a twist.
fine gameplay, bad hitboxes and graphics

ĞÑ‚Ğ»Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°, ÑĞ¾Ğ²ĞµÑ‚ÑƒÑ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ
Ğ’ĞµÑˆĞ°ÑÑÑŒ ĞºĞ°Ğ¶Ğ´Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ´ĞµĞ½ÑŒğŸ—

Normally I would recommend this game for people as it has managed to create its own niche as it is the only asymmetrical horror game that has an active player base. However, the state of the game has been on a long decline because of the fact that they no competition in the market. The developers are to blame for this as they have continuously released broken and buggy content while ignoring player feedback. The best example of this is the issue of colour-blind accessibility which took the developers four years to add into the game only after an article was written about one of the devs snide comments to people requesting it. 4 YEARS.

The last four DLCs for this game have also had buggy and broken messes that existed for far too long. The Blight from the â€œDescent Beyondâ€ chapter is still in rough shape as his mechanics donâ€™t work 100% of the time. Players, myself included, complained about the height of his camera as it didnâ€™t match his player model. This was fixed nine months after release while he still slides off a lot of objects. â€œA Binding of Kinâ€ was extremely buggy in the PTB and none of these bugs were fixed with the live launch of the game. The game was unstable, laggy, and the Twins were prone to frequent camera issues and getting stuck in places. â€œAll-Killâ€ was a completely forgettable chapter that introduced the Trickster who is very weak killer and again, the developers did not listen to feedback from the PTB. The â€œAll-Killâ€ chapter is most remembered for the previously mentioned Blight POV fix and Wraith buff (which had been requested for years). The current chapter follows the long line of Behaviour releasing a broken and buggy mess as the new map has been disabled for crashing consoles with consoles also being extremely laggy in games. Community feedback was ignored once again from the PTB with no real changes being made to concerns.

Another gripe that I have with this game is the grind. The in-game currency has become completely inflated over the years as it was originally made for only about 26 perks for each side. They added tiers to the perks to extend the grind of the game and therefore made it so there are technically 78 perks to unlock to get everything. The issue today is that there are 95 survivor perks and 84 for killers with the same tier system meaning you need to unlock 285 and 252 perks respectively. To put that into perspective I have over 700 hours in the game with only one survivor with all perks and one killer. 
Tl;dr Devs bad, grind bad. Do not recommend to newer players
I have been a long time fan and started on xbox, it sucks I have to start over but I still have a blast playing.
